title: Strictly's Catherine Tyldesley throws subtle shade at judges after exit
text:
Catherine Tyldesley was eliminated from Strictly on Sunday (Picture: BBC/PA; WENN)

Catherine Tyldesley has thrown some very subtle shade at the Strictly Come Dancing judges after being eliminated from the competition last night.

The Coronation Street actress and her partner Johannes Radebe were voted off after failing to impress the panel after a dance-off against Mike Bushell and Katya Jones – sparking uproar with fans.

And now Catherine has liked a tweet suggesting that she was ‘the better dancer’ of the evening, seemingly showing what she makes of the whole shambles.

‘Sorry but @Cath_Tyledesley did not deserve to go tonight in @bbcstrictly… she was the better dance by far…’ read the message from Catherine’s co-star Hayley Tamaddon.

‘Hold your head up high my darling Cath… you’ve been a joy to watch from start to finish. Big love to you and @jojo_radebe.’

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Catherine liked this tweet (Picture: Twitter)

Craig Revel Horwood chose to save Mike and Katya, while Motsi Mabuse and Bruno Tonioli opted for Catherine and Johannes, but it was Shirley Ballas who had the deciding vote and chose the former.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Upon delivering her verdict, Shirley said: ‘I thought both couples really stepped it up a notch and this is always the most difficult decision for me.

‘But based on a good focus, difficult content with some really beautiful footwork in there with stronger technical skills, for me, clean and polished, I’m going to save Mike and Katya.’

When asked about her time on the show, Catherine said: ‘Him [Johannes], yeah, he’s like my best friend.

‘He’s just…oooh, (referring to eye make-up) it’s waterproof…just the opportunity to work with amazing people and get critiqued off amazing people.

‘I never thought I’d say this, I’m going to keep it up because I fell in love with it! I’ve loved every second, this man has changed my life.’

Strictly Come Dancing continues Saturday at 7pm on BBC One.

description: Strictly Come Dancing's Catherine Tyldesley throws subtle shade at judges after shock elimination on Sunday's results.
